website_summaries.verdict: Unless you plan to shoot primarily in low light, the Canon PowerShot A720 IS makes a solid, affordable camera that produces great-looking pictures.
pros: Great image quality at lower ISOs

customer_reviews.title: Powered by 2 AA batteries.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very capable older camera. It arrived in very good condition aside from the Date / Time button battery being dead but it was easily replaced & now works fine. This camera runs on 2 AA batteries which will always be available world wide. Its runs a long time on high capacity rechargabe batteries. Generic AC/DC AA chargers are very inexpensive. A good little camera that also has full manual control if you want more creative control.
customer_reviews.author: DAVID H BUTEAU

customer_reviews.title: Best Camera I've Ever Owned
customer_reviews.text: I've owned cameras that were far more expensive, but this is the only camera I've owned that I ever fell in love with. It fits easily in a pocket, but yet it has features that will satisfy a sophisticated photographer. And people love the photos I've taken with this camera. As far as I can tell, Canon has not produced a better camera since this one - I've owned two Canon cameras since, but this one is by far the best. This camera has a viewfinder, which I love. I wonder why so many cameras don't have them any more. You can't see LCD displays in bright sunlight.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph R. Offer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome camera
customer_reviews.text: We loved this camera, and would still be using it if the battery case latch (plastic) had not broken. Even with it broken we tried using rubber-bands to hold it closed so we could keep using this camera. It takes great pictures and has great manual controls. After about 3 years of use, it did develop hot spots (pixels that were always white), but I was able to use CHDK (Canon Hacker Development Kit--from online sources) to highlight and remove the bad pixels from the pictures. Need to get another Canon SX150 or 260HS to replace this awesome camera.
customer_reviews.author: jobew

customer_reviews.title: A sleeper of a good deal
customer_reviews.text: I've worked as a professional photographer for 9 years. I retired from that profession 10 years ago and moved into IS Management. My eyes just can't focus the way they used to. This camera has all the versatility of my Leica m-3 (all manual) but I can use a whole collection of focusing routines as well as exposure tricks. The image processor and image stabilizer are quite good. The color is natural. The technology is fantastic. I just wish the shell was made of metal and more lenses were available. I've got 3 kids in college, so our budget is tight. At this price. the only better deal will be its Cannon successor.
customer_reviews.author: David Hill

customer_reviews.title: love my Canon
customer_reviews.text: The camera is super! It's light weight and take-it-anywhere-you-go thing. I'm taking it with me every weekend when I go out and the pictures it creates are cool and satisfying. Has quite many functions that let's you make a lot of fun. Strongly recommend if you want a camera to take high quality pictures with reasonable price (when on sale) and comfortable to use. Love my Canon. update: it's been already a 3 years i have this camera and it's great! even after dropping it and in child's hands, you can imagine. it still takes great pictures and works fine. it's really worth buying. i love my Canon <3
customer_reviews.author: Sallo.Me

customer_reviews.title: Flash recharge is slow as molasses
customer_reviews.text: I had mine for about a week and had to return it to Amazon. The time between flashes is way too long. I missed many shots as I was waiting for the flash to recharge. I did use the Kingston Elite Pro SD card and was not shooting at maximum resolution. The lag obviously isn't related to writing the picture to the card as there is no lag when shooting a picture without the flash. My previous Canon was a four-battery model and didn't have this issue. So I bought a new Canon PowerShot A630 which is a four-battery model and the problem is fixed. I would give that camera five stars!
customer_reviews.author: Zig

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic quality built camera
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic pictures and I have read that this camera has developed an almost cult-like following which have driven the prices up for this gem of a camera. But it is well worth it as I don't think cameras nowadays are made with the same quality as this model was. Bought mine years ago and is still working the same as it did when it was new.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Wallace

customer_reviews.title: beautiful pictures!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this camera for a little over a year and a half and have never had a problem with it. It takes fabulous pictures. There are many settings which can be overwhelming, but I easily learned what was what. The battery life isn't that great, but I noticed it lasted awhile past the 'low battery' icon. Once I got rechargeable batteries I never had an issue with the battery life. The camera is a little larger, but it fit in my purse just fine. The zoom is larger on this camera than the slim cameras which is nice. Overall I am very happy with this camera.
customer_reviews.author: BeachLadee

customer_reviews.title: It's ok - prefer the S5
customer_reviews.text: This camera is decent, excellent if you consider the price point. However, I was simply not thrilled with the image quality and ended up returning the camera. I also found that when the camera was on center focus (my preference over face recognition) that I found many of my picture focused on the background instead of the focal point which I set. For the Amazon price, this is a good point and shoot camera. However, I recommend the S5 (which I bought after returning the 720)for superior performance and image quality.
customer_reviews.author: B. Beauman

customer_reviews.title: Canon Power Shot
customer_reviews.text: Book was delivered within 10 days of ordering it. It came to me in the condition that the seller described. this camera is good for traveling and not having to have professional quality pictures. The zoom feature is limited. If too far away from the main subject of the picture, it will turn out very small, and may not be a picture worth taking. But, for an everyday camera, it is a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Heat

customer_reviews.title: my number 2 camera
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera. I have a canon 30D with 6 lenses as well and I use this camera to take pictures where lugging the gear is not an attractive option. Frankly in good conditions the pictures are just as good. Where it not up to the challenge I use the other camera. One of the reasons that I chose this over the G9 is that it runs on AA batteries. I don't want to miss pictures in some remote location because I didn't bring the right adapter.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Canon A720
customer_reviews.text: Camera seems o.k., but not as good as my Canon A700 which bit the dust after no more than 5000 shots. The A700 shutter no longer closes, and two other friends have reported same problem with theirs. Because of this, I really did not want to buy another Canon. However, I could not find another reasonably priced camera with a VIEWFINDER, so I bought the A720. The housing has a cheaper feel, and the pix I have so far taken, not as rich. Latter problem might be my fault, but if it has as short a life as my last one, this will be my last Canon.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Langer

customer_reviews.title: Manual or automatic: great all-around camera.
customer_reviews.text: Whether you are an amateur or experienced photographer, the Canon Powershot A7201IS delivers great pictures without the bulk or expense of a digital SLR. Compact size and a range of automatic modes make it a handy "point and shoot" camera anyone can use with ease. Manual modes allow the more experienced photographer to control the aperture and shutter speed to manipulate lighting effects and depth of field -- just like with an old-fashioned SLR. Is that cool or what? Extra zoom (4X) and large LCD screen are icing on the cake. Very impressive little camera.
customer_reviews.author: Marianne N.

customer_reviews.title: Vacation camera
customer_reviews.text: Bought this camera for one specific reason, vacations! My DSLR is just to big for every purpose. I wanted something to carry in my pocket so I could be "hands free". But, I didn't want to have to compromise picture quality. I purchase several other 8 mega pix cameras and took them back because the pix wasn't good. Yup, tried to save a few bucks by getting a camera for less money and it taught me a lesson. This Canon has great reviews and will get a workout right off the bat in Huatulco....
customer_reviews.author: Rex

customer_reviews.title: Excellent camera, great price/performance
customer_reviews.text: Once upon a time I purchased a Canon G2. My life was good. Then I was enticed to buy a Samsung camera. My life was not good. I have returned to Canon. I now believe that only traditional camera makers can be trusted to design great optical systems at a good price. I would recommend to anybody to be leery of electronic companies that move into cameras. This camera takes great pictures and is user friendly. For most users, including myself, that's all I need.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Best Camera Ever and Very Durable!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the Best camera I have ever owned. I liked it so much that I bought another one for my wife. I fly a AirCreation Trike and I take photos from the air. It handles very well with one hand operation, (the other hand is doing the flying). Very clear pictures because of the stabilization. Easy to review pictures on the back of the camera and is also nice to have a viewfinder for very sunny days. Very good price. $200 plus $20 for a Kingston 2GB, 120X ultimate SD card. R. Holm
customer_reviews.author: Russ

customer_reviews.title: Great little camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera is a joy to use. The optical zoom and viewfinder are features that make possible shots that are very difficult to get otherwise. The AA battery form factor lets me toss in fresh batteries whenever I need, without spending a fortune for specific batteries. An LCD viewfinder would have been a nice touch, but for the price, I'm not complaining. The user interface is wonderfully intuitive. Great buy- I've recommended it to anyone who will sit still for my pitch!
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Better cameras cost a LOT more
customer_reviews.text: Yes, I bought this on recommendation from a couple of magazine articles and a friend's advice too. And I'm glad I did. It contains features that far more expensive cameras have and the quality of the prints is perfect! This was a gift for my wife. It needed to be small, reliable, efficient on battery use, simple to use and produce great snapshots. It does all of these things well. I believe that right now you can't buy a better camera for this price.
customer_reviews.author: Steve D. Marsh

customer_reviews.title: Great "by your side" Camera. If you can find one in good shape, Get it.
customer_reviews.text: Tried and true quality. This is one of four cameras I use. I think it is the best, take anywhere, keep by your side, grab for quick capture, little cameras you can own. The photo quality is superb, for such a little rugged Canon. I am all Sony now, except for this one.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Lee

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use!
customer_reviews.text: I can't get into any of the technical merits of this camera because I have no idea what any of it means. What i can tell you is that for an amateur to photography this camera is great! I bought it for my trip to Hawaii. It's easy to use and the pictures are amazing. You'll need to use rechargeable batteries and carry extras with you, but it's actually worth it since you can just recharge them. I really like this camera and recommend it if you just need to take pictures and are looking for something easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Mimi

customer_reviews.title: Digital Camera
customer_reviews.text: An somewhat old tech digital camera that, for the price, is my top choice.
customer_reviews.author: William C. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: 6X PowerShot
customer_reviews.text: This camera has, to date, lived up to all our expectations, in spite of the fact it initially had some foreign material on the surface of the photo sensor internal to the camera. This was discovered in the images after about a week of use. The unit was quickly cleaned/repaired by Canon (less than a week from date of return to back home). They even covered all shipping costs both directions to the repair depot. It is exceptionally light due to its use of only 2 AA rechargeable batteries for power. The 6x lens, Image Stabilization, 8 mega pixel resolution, and 1600 ISO capability in one package make it a great value for its size and price.
customer_reviews.author: R. W. Badger

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect first digital camera. Does everything well. Make sure you get an extra SD card with 512MB or 1GB - I got a Transcend 1MB for about $15 bucks (don't buy from a camera shop, you'll pay too much). The cameras don't come with a card that holds much. Downloading to the computer using one program, then editing with another, could be a more streamlined process, but it's not bad once you know what to do.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: CANON POWERSHOT 720 IS IS THE BEST!
customer_reviews.text: We bought the Canon 720 IS camera with underwater housing and accessory kit, and we could not be more pleased. It takes crystal clear pictures, and is super easy to use. Gorgeous clear bright shots. We bought the housing as well and used it on a recent scuba diving trip to Cozumel, MX. We did not buy the strobe, and found we really did not need it for day diving. The pictures were wonderful. Great camera! Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: DIANE

customer_reviews.title: 4-3/4 stars.... almost 5!
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with this camera after several weeks and several hundred pictures. The only reservation I have is the "system pause" after taking a picture. This small characteristic can be bothersome at times. Battery usage is low and with a 4-gig card you can shoot pics all day without having to transfer. Great camera which I would recommend to anyone, even for semi-pro use with the good selction of manual features.
customer_reviews.author: Coast-Lover

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Camera for its Price
customer_reviews.text: I just received this camera about a week ago. Took it to Muir Woods and took outstanding pictures. Still learning all of the different manual options this camera offers which are many. Pros: Outstanding Pictures Great Price Good Zoom Cons: Batteries Die fast Picture taking a bit slow especially when using Flash One other very small gripe is the ability to "preview" the last picture taken is not possible unless you slide the lever down. Wish it were possible to have a one button click to view the last picture taken. Other than these very small gripes this camera is excellent. I would highly recommend this camera.
customer_reviews.author: M&M

customer_reviews.title: Excellent camera
customer_reviews.text: The pruchase of this camera through Amazon was terrific, easy, fast and received camera exactly when promised. The camera is easy to use and the pictures are great. The flash carries great, the night time and fireworks setting is wonderful, catches children playing without blur and is everything I wanted in a camera. Will probably purchase another from Amazon for my daughter. Great price.
customer_reviews.author: Charmaine W. James

customer_reviews.title: It was a good working camera
customer_reviews.text: Haven't owned this in 3 or more years. It was a good working camera, but the latch on the batteries kept coming lose or breaking off. This happened with two Canon's. I'm happier with my smartphone camera now.
customer_reviews.author: JMA1943

customer_reviews.title: Great carry camera
customer_reviews.text: This is a great camera for taking all kinds of snap and shoot pictures. It has a great size. Easy to carry and once you read the manual, is great for all those pictures you take on vacation. I also have a Nikon D80 which has its place in the picture taking agenda. Enjoy this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: this is an afterthought review
customer_reviews.text: I returned this product because of shutter lag & not really enough zoom for me. The seller was more than helpful & accomodating. I bought a Canon SX210IS. It has just as much shutter lag. At any zoom over 10x you need a tripod - which is difficult on any trip moving with a group. BUT MOST important is the lack of viewfinder!! It is dramatic how many photos are out of focus for lack of ability to steady camera against one's head. etc etc
customer_reviews.author: T. Arn UK

customer_reviews.title: VERY PLEASED WITH THIS CHOICE SO FAR
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with the camera so far. I plan to use it extensively on an upcoming trip to Europe. It does everything that I require. It does not have any internal memory. I quickly ran out of room on the sd card that came with it after 4 pictures. If it had a bit of internal memory it would have helped me to finish my project and go inside for a larger card.
customer_reviews.author: R. Coward

customer_reviews.title: Small Handy camera that does what it is supposed to do
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what i needed for my Under water photography. Bought the casing to take this diving. Love the built in red filter. colours of pictures a bright and clear. Just happy with this product. Perfect for sea and land. ( use it for my work photo also.)
customer_reviews.author: JAA

customer_reviews.title: Great little camera
customer_reviews.text: Great little camera. Had one for 6 years, it broke, I liked it so much I replaced it with the same model.
customer_reviews.author: MS Denver

customer_reviews.title: Canon 720  is
customer_reviews.text: So far seems to work well and is a handy size to carry. I'm not sure how much good the image stabalization does as seems to have no obvious effect when viewing through the lcd monitor even on max telephoto. The flash recovering time is excessive if one does much in the way of indoor flash activities. It is about 5-6 seconds. Personally I don't care but if one takes a lot of flash this camera is not a good choice. Except for the puzzle on the stabalization I am satisfied with the camera.
customer_reviews.author: TC Bryant

customer_reviews.title: A good camera
customer_reviews.text: This compact camera is perfect and easy to use and best value. I like the way standard batteries can be used.
customer_reviews.author: EBRAHIM K.

customer_reviews.title: Canon A720IS: A-Series Capability and More!!
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded to the PowerShot A720IS from my original digital camera, the Canon A75. I wanted to stay with a PowerShot A-series because I have been very happy with the optics, manual capabilities, viewfinder, size and shape but I wanted more zoom. With the A75, I was limited to 3x because I could never get a crisp shot with the digital zoom. The A720IS image stabilization allows in-focus, crisp zoom shots (6x optical/up to 24x digital) in addition to all the other good things the PowerShot A-series provides and at a good price.
customer_reviews.author: C. Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Awesome camera.. takes beautiful pictures
customer_reviews.text: I have done a lot of research before purchasing this product. So I had really high expectations to start with and the camera did not disappoint. It comes with a lot of options, modes and features like Image stabilization and face detection. If you are looking for a point and click camera, this is great and you are looking for a little optimization, its all there too. It is a good mid range camera. The pictures are all very sharp and clear. Would recommend to anyone looking for a decent mid range camera for a cheap price. If you want a really good camera, SLR is the way to go.
customer_reviews.author: Jagadish

customer_reviews.title: A good little camera for the price
customer_reviews.text: The camera I had the flash died. I ordered this one and all the features work. A good little camera for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Danny R. Gunter

customer_reviews.title: Great camera, great price
customer_reviews.text: We just got back from a 2 week vacation, I took 179 photos. I'm glad I only got the 1 Gig card, for it, as I didn't use half of the space. A little bulky, but great features and great price more than make up for it. It still fit in my pocket, to haul around all day, and the 6x zoom covers most things you want to shoot. GMVB
customer_reviews.author: Gregory W. Luft

customer_reviews.title: SUPER CAMERA
customer_reviews.text: THIS IS MY FIRST CANNON PRODUCT BUT WON'T BE THE LAST THIS CAMERA HAS BEEN A GREAT EXPERIENCE THUS FAR.....THE ONE THING WHICH IMPRESSED ME MOST ABOUT CANNON IS THEIR EXCELLENT CUSTOMER SERVICE STAFF...I SIMPLY CALLED THEIR TOLL FREE NUMBER FOR SOME FEATURE EXPLANATION AND WAS GREETED BY AN INDIVIDUAL WHO SPENT OVER AND HALF AN HOUR EXPLAINING TO ME HOW TO USE SPECIFIC FEATURES OF THE CAMERA (AN EXPERIENCE I WILL LONG CHERISH) I HAVE TOLD ALL OF MY FRIENDS WHAT A GREAT STAFF OF SUPPORT PERSONNEL CANNON HAS...NO WONDER THEY ARE THE PREFERRED CAMERA FOR THE NFL
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Fan

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement camera
customer_reviews.text: This reconditioned camera was an exact replacement for one that broke. It was in like new condition.
customer_reviews.author: K. R. Thorpe

customer_reviews.title: This is a great camera
customer_reviews.text: Great camera. I somehow lost my original camera so I bought the same one (used) for a fraction of the cost through Amazon and have zero complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Canon A series camera. The camera is simple to operate, has a great 6X zoom and takes high quality pictures. Only negative is the relatively slow flash recycle time of 4.5 seconds. Large LCD display is great even in bright sunlight. Canon has been a very good suppier to deal with for questions or problems. Very easy and fast to speak to a human.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence J. Bielen

customer_reviews.title: good camera, bad software
customer_reviews.text: This is my fourth Canon camera and it is a good camera. However, the software that they provide to download the pictures is terrible. It is much worse than the software that came with every other Canon camera that I have purchased. I recommend buying a different Canon camera just for this reason.
customer_reviews.author: Keith OH/MI

customer_reviews.title: Olympus is better than Canon
customer_reviews.text: I can't help giving this camera an average review. I have done a lot of research online and the Powershots always come out best. This is the second powershot I bought and return (sorry Amazon, you are the greatest). It takes OK pictures but it just doesn't compare to the cheap Olympus Camedea that I have. My friend also has an Olympus taking GREAT pictures. According to online reviews, Olympus would be worse than Canon...Let this be a review in favor of Olympus.
customer_reviews.author: Minoes

customer_reviews.title: Great camera!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great camera. It would be better if it had more than one video mode, right now you can record on high or low resolution, one is pretty good the other one is bad. It's great you can remove the lens to change it for a better one. Easy to use, not pro not simple, great balance!
customer_reviews.author: Jose Montero

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: Are old digital Canon was dropped and unworkable. We purchased the a720is and couldn't beleave how this camera has advanced in a few years. The big screen is much nicer to review the pictures. This camera takes AA batteries is so convienent. The dial turns so much easier than the old camera. Many picture taking modes with a turn of the dial. The buttons are simple and easy to use. And the quality of the pictures is great.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Camera and a Very Nice Price
customer_reviews.text: This is my second digital camera and I couldn't be more pleased. I love that it uses AA batteries, has a large viewing screen and it easy to use and to change settings. It is lightweight and very comfortable to hold. Although I am still learning to use all the features, I am very pleased with the photos I have already taken and happy that I selected this particular camera.
customer_reviews.author: M. J. Diehl

customer_reviews.title: Great pictures...when you can get them
customer_reviews.text: I had an older Canon that worked great until one day the display went black and couldn't take pictures. I had such a great experience with Cannon so I decided to look at just Canon's. I wanted one that I could use AA rechargeable batteries so that's why we chose this one after much research. This camera takes great pictures BUT the recycle time is soooo loooong that I miss out on great photo opportunities. I never expected the recycle time to be longer than my old camera because it has newer technology. I'm not sure I'd buy this camera again knowing that.
customer_reviews.author: K.L.Mol

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, easy camera!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome Camera. Takes great pictures without ever thinking about it.
customer_reviews.author: Surveyor Scott

customer_reviews.title: Camera was a big "rougher" than I thought it would ...
customer_reviews.text: Camera was a big "rougher" than I thought it would be, but as a used item I cannot complain. It works as I expected.
customer_reviews.author: BobP

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is a replacement for an existing unit that was damaged by battery leakage
customer_reviews.author: JSC

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: VERY GOOD CAMERA, OLDER VERSION NOW BUT STILL A GREAT CAMERA
customer_reviews.author: Firestarter48

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Choice I made!
customer_reviews.text: I had a terrible experience with Sony MP8 digital last September due to lens problem as I mentioned before.(Now I gave it to a friend's kid as a toy). Then some professional photographer recommended this one. I used it for my last trip with my children and grandkids to Orlando in this past Thanksgiving. Wonderful, wonderful. I found more wonderful feathers than I expected for $215.00 I paid for. Image stablizer, 6x (v.s. 3x as in the majority),movie play, night scene, firework,...etc. It is so easy for a grandma to us, and the result is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Angie

customer_reviews.title: Great indoor and outdoor camera
customer_reviews.text: This is our second PowerShot Camera. We enjoy using both of them. This camera takes great pictures. We are not professional photographers but this camera helps make the shots look professional. The price is very reasonable and the shipping speed is very prompt.
customer_reviews.author: B. Wright

customer_reviews.title: Excellent camera
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this camera for about 9 months now, and I'm very happy with it. The battery life is great, the display is big, and it's packed full of great features. The only drawback is that it can take a few seconds for the flash to recharge, and the camera isn't the smallest one you can buy. But on the other hand, you have a lot of control over how your pictures are taken through various manual settings, the picture and movie quality is very good, zoom is decent, and the camera uses non-proprietary NiMH AA batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Dino

customer_reviews.title: Nice camera
customer_reviews.text: Chose this unit based on reviews. Wife had smaller, thin camera and left it somewhere. This is not a big camera but is large enough that it is harder to leave behind. LCD screen is very large and nice. Easy to read controls, pictures have been excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Picky Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Lives up to expectations.
customer_reviews.text: The Canon Powershot has so far lived up to my hopes. The stabilization seems to work fairly well even when I zoom in far as the 6X optical allows. Delay between shots is less than with my previous. I'm looking forward to albums full of happy gran'baby snapshots.
customer_reviews.author: R. Guthrie

customer_reviews.title: So good we now have two
customer_reviews.text: This is a GREAT camera! I bought one for my wife and we liked it so much that I bought one for myself. We will be using them when we don't want to carry our DSLR's or as a backup to our DSLR's while on our trip to Europe this summer. Picture quality is extreemly good for a point and shoot camera (actually it is almost as sufisticated as my DSLR). It has a very good zoom range (equivalent to 35mm to 210mm). I really like the image stabilization feature, I wish my DSLR had it. Great buy and high quality camera.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Camera
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research before I bought this camera. I own a few other digital cameras that are not made by Canon and I was not pleased with quality of the pictures these cameras took. So, I began to do a lot of research on the internet and asking people I know what type of digital cameras they had. Pleasantly supprised a lot of the people I spoke to prefered Canon Digital Cameras. I've had this camera for about two months and I love the pictures that I have taken with it. I'm extremely happy with this camera and would recommend to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: L. Perry

customer_reviews.title: Happy
customer_reviews.text: I bought the A720 to replace our A520 which we lost. I am very happy with the quality of photos and the speed of being able to take repeat shots compared to the A520. We just returned from Kauai and the trip is well-recorded with quality photos.
customer_reviews.author: A. L. Rhodes

customer_reviews.title: Canon PowerShot A720IS -- A Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: Use Eneloop rechargeable AA batteries and you will get very long battery life, especially if you don't use the flash. The best features of this camera are portability, a viewfinder, and the use of standard batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Alysha Nicholas

customer_reviews.title: Great camera!
customer_reviews.text: It's a great camera. I had an A550 but this is even nicer. Image the stabilization, bigger screen, higher res. This is a good buy. Canon makes quality stuff. Get the 2GB memory card and you can take over 500 pics at the highest resolution.
customer_reviews.author: Marc R.

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera to replace an aging Powershot A40 that I bought several years ago. I wanted something easy to use, somewhat small, good picture quality and some macro capability. This camera had it all. The macro mode has been unbelievable. It is able to focus and shoot a lot closer than I will ever need and still gets really good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremiah R

customer_reviews.title: Canon A720
customer_reviews.text: Great camera, very good snapshots. The zoom is good, but you really need to have the camera on a tripod or other very stable platform to get good pictures at the extreme zooms. I tried at a recent graduation, and most shots were just wavy lines! Does anyone make a cable release for these cameras so you don't have to push the button on top of the camera?
customer_reviews.author: Ken in TN

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic camera for the price
customer_reviews.text: This camera is all we expected and more. It is easy to use, takes very clear pictures, and is small enough that we actually take it with us. The 6X optical zoom sets it apart from most of the cameras in this class.
customer_reviews.author: M. Everton

customer_reviews.title: New Canon Digital Camera
customer_reviews.text: I am a senior citizen and this is my first digital camera. The instruction booklet is easy to follow and the pictures I have taken are absolutely wonderful in clarity, etc. I have downloaded the photos onto "My Pictures" on my computer with Windows XP. Purchasing this camera via Amazon was a most pleasant and affordable way of obtaining a digital camera.
customer_reviews.author: Robert W. Schleipman

customer_reviews.title: Best camera!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best camera for everyday use. Every time I try something else I end up returning it because nothing can compare. It's easy, durable, and high quality.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: Wanted a higher resolution camera to replace our last digital. So far this one is simple to use, takes great photos and is a great value for the price. Can't go wrong with this camera!
customer_reviews.author: Colorado Fun

customer_reviews.title: served us well
customer_reviews.text: works well have had it for 6 years for the price it take good pics
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Camera Works Well for Me
customer_reviews.text: This camera is just what I needed to take pictures of items for my Etsy store and my blog. It's easy, straightforward, and takes lovely pictures. The only ackward feature for me is working the little door to the photo cards and batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Maple Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great camera: Canon PowerShot A720IS 8MP
customer_reviews.text: I'm no camera whiz. This camera worked great for me on a recent vacation. It does the smart stuff autamatically (facial recognition, image stabilization) and the viewfinder is a blessing in bright sunlight.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: This product is of high quality for me. I love it I recommend this to everyone for their excellent design
customer_reviews.author: Eduardo Romero

customer_reviews.title: Terrific!
customer_reviews.text: This camera is terrific, the picture quality is excellent and it has a lot of good functionality for taking different kinds of pictures. The face detection is very helpful for getting the correct focus. A good point and shoot camera with functionality for more advanced users as well.
customer_reviews.author: Camela Beaty

customer_reviews.title: Very good picture quality
customer_reviews.text: Batteries wear out very fast. However, the camera functions well. Very good picture quality.
customer_reviews.author: Humbleheart

customer_reviews.title: Best Camera for point and shoot
customer_reviews.text: This camera has to be the best for the under $250 catagory. Does everything that you would ever need unless you are a professional. Great extras, easy to understand and work. No need to look at others, the Canon 720 is all you'll ever need.
customer_reviews.author: Hungary Joe

customer_reviews.title: good camera
customer_reviews.text: so far we really like our canon powershot A720IS. takes great pics, has lots of options and isn't big and heavy but still enough to hold onto. great camera for the price.
customer_reviews.author: shancloughy

customer_reviews.title: Great Affordable Camera
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera! It has many features for an affordable digital camera with good image quality. The picture quality is outstanding! The only thing I have found thus far that is not great is the time it takes to process pictures when you snap pictures. It can make it difficult to obtain action shots.
customer_reviews.author: Gidget

customer_reviews.title: Superb valu
customer_reviews.text: My friends are jealous! They own much more expensive cameras and want to borrow mine. Easy to use, great quality, and the price was excellent. Much better than I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Awesome affordable camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera is excellent for the price. Gives you plenty of choices in controls for a point-and-shoot, and the color is exceptional. It takes pix quickly and it is easy to learn. Simple and quite effective. I would buy it compared to other higher-end point-and-shoots for the features alone, and, compounded with the price, it's just the best in its range.
customer_reviews.author: Pistol Pete

customer_reviews.title: It was purchased as a backup trail camera and does ...
customer_reviews.text: It was purchased as a backup trail camera and does exactly what I wanted it to do. phto quality is about 3 star.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great camera!
customer_reviews.text: My husband needed an easy-to-use point-and-shoot to capture images for later use in his art. This camera has been perfect: user-friendly and great images.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Savage

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: This is my third digital camera, they just get better all the time. The Canon A720 takes great pictures, nice 6x zoom, good closeups, etc...As others have pointed out, flash refresh is slow. but I love it
customer_reviews.author: Larry L

customer_reviews.title: Image stabilized at 24X  digital
customer_reviews.text: I didn't realize that image stabilization really works great at maximum digital power, without a tripod. I used my camera at a concert that my grand daughter was in. It was a low light setting with no flash allowed. I set the camera to low light scene and went to max power and pushed the button half way down to focus. The stabilization took over and I got unblurred picture without flash or tripod.
customer_reviews.author: Amazed

customer_reviews.title: Good camera for the time
customer_reviews.text: Thisz is now an outdated camera but was excellent in its time, by todays standards it will be to slow to go from one shot to the next plus tha small plastics were unstable and broke.- the supplier was fine.
customer_reviews.author: Albert Shashoua

customer_reviews.title: As others have said, excellent camera but slow flash
customer_reviews.text: Love the camera. The flash delay is the only thing that I don't like. I'm going to try some photo AA batteries to see if that helps.
customer_reviews.author: C. CROSBY

customer_reviews.title: Endless Shooting!!!
customer_reviews.text: been using this item for so long, i've lost count how many pics and videos taken...Do the math, bought 4 years ago and still working great...Will buy it again and again....just would improve the optical zoom a couple of points more! But still one of my favorite products so far!!!
customer_reviews.author: JRT

customer_reviews.title: Canon PowerShot A720 IS
customer_reviews.text: Recently I lost my Canon PowerShot A720 IS through sheer carelessness. I liked the Camera so well that I ordered another one. The service from Amazon and Ritz was great. Will buy from these people again.
customer_reviews.author: Norman H. Tooren

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: I am enjoying the Canon a720is camera. I was looking for a camera that a person without a lot of experience could use. I also wanted image stabilization and some features that I could learn to use. I wish the shutter speed was a little faster. It is still hard for me to capture the smiles of little kids. Overall it is a great camera. The zoom is a feature that I am learning to apprectate.
customer_reviews.author: K. Van Steenis

customer_reviews.title: Exact replacement for one I lost!!  Great!!
customer_reviews.text: This camera is in better condition than the one I lost-- I love this model for its combination of optical viewfinder for outdoor use, image stabilization and 6x optical zoom--!
customer_reviews.author: I. Magerkurth

customer_reviews.title: Nice point and shoot
customer_reviews.text: Great little point and shoot for the money. Good points: Ease of use, good pic quality Bad points: not so easy access to sd card I'll be glad when the write speed for digital cameras gets a little faster. I bought a super high speed card and that seemed to help a little.
customer_reviews.author: A.A

customer_reviews.title: Great deal!
customer_reviews.text: My husband wanted a camera to use for his trail cam, so he could look at the pictures on the TV. This is the same camera I have, which came with an AV cord to enable this. We each have the same camera now, and just one AV cord. Perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Plyoder

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.text: I was very satisfied with this recent purchase. The camera was in even better condition than I had imagined. The entire transaction went extremely smoothly.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Nilgai

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding digital camera
customer_reviews.text: Like all digital cameras, you really have to read the directions and use the camera to fully appreciate its sophistication. However, it even works great with just knowing how to turn it on and take a picture in the Ph.D. (Push here Dummy) mode.
customer_reviews.author: snoshow

customer_reviews.title: Canon PowerShot A720IS
customer_reviews.text: Nice camera, easy to use, with great resolution and useful zoom in a small package. More than 2-second delay between shots, however, is a nuisance and often results in missing a good photo.
customer_reviews.author: Lifetime Student

customer_reviews.title: great camera!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this camera about a month now and I really like it. It is fairly easy to use, has little shutter lag and takes great pictures. There are alot of features that I probably won't use, but it's good to know we've got options :)
customer_reviews.author: MAC

customer_reviews.title: slow flash recharge
customer_reviews.text: great zoom, easy to learn features, nice big LCD screen, multiple functions and shoot modes for most people's needs, manual option. unfortunately the flash takes a really long time to recharge between shots; while the flash is recharging the screen goes blank. the flash recharge is slow even with brand new batteries
customer_reviews.author: S. holtz

customer_reviews.title: canon 720
customer_reviews.text: great camera, great price, extremely happy with this purchase - brother bought the same camera and recommended it to me - we both love the camera easy to use and very clear pictures
customer_reviews.author: James F. Struhs

customer_reviews.title: EASY
customer_reviews.text: This is my first digital camera and was surprised and relieved at how easy it is to use.
customer_reviews.author: C. M. Carisalez

customer_reviews.title: Small Wonder
customer_reviews.text: Looking for a compact camera that does it all? Try this little Canon. With it's 6X optical zoom, 8MB quality, Image stabilizer, optional manual control and small size, this baby has it all. I am not a photographer so what I find most appealing is the automatic nature of the camera. But I have friends who do "know cameras" who have looked at it and marveled at the options available in such a small package. Good price, quality product, ease of use . . . equals a great value.
customer_reviews.author: J. Thigpen

product_meta.title: Canon PowerShot A720IS 8MP Digital Camera with 6x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom (OLD MODEL)
product_meta.description:
CL) PS3) Canon A720 IS DISC BY MFG

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Manufacturer Description 

 The PowerShot A720 IS is the quintessential A Series camera in a popular line that matches high-end image quality with fun, easy-to-use features that deliver excellent cost performance. Top-notch specifications include 8.0-megapixel resolution and a long 6x optical zoom with Optical Image Stabilizer Technology for sharp images throughout the zoom range. Canon's DIGIC III Image Processor offers advanced Face Detection technology and Red-eye Correction for fantastic images. Even expand your creative possibilities with wide-angle and telephoto converter lenses. 

PowerShot A720IS Highlights 

8.0-megapixel resolution, high-power 6x optical zoom with Optical Image Stabilizer Top-notch core specifications allow the PowerShot A720 IS to produce a level of image quality that’s fully competitive with that of much higher-end cameras. A full 8.0 megapixels of resolution ensure rich depth and detail, and let you enlarge and crop images freely. 



1x zoom/6x zoom The camera is equipped with a genuine Canon 6x optical zoom to get you up close when it counts. Canon’s sophisticated Optical Image Stabilizer Technology keeps your shots blur-free, even in low light and at the long end of the zoom range. Miniature gyroscopic sensors detect motion, then send a corrective signal, effectively reducing camera shake. 

DIGIC III Image Processor with Genuine Canon Face Detection Technology With DIGIC III, your images boast superior quality, the camera operates at top efficiency and battery life is enhanced. What’s more, DIGIC III enables Canon’s Face Detection Technology and Red-eye Correction to give you better, more true-to-life people shots. Simply press the Shutter button halfway down, and the camera automatically pinpoints the faces in the scene and chooses the ideal focus point. The camera controls exposure settings and flash to keep every face looking bright and natural. Red eyes can be corrected during playback. 

DIGIC III features Face Detection technologies, giving the you best possible results in any shooting situation. Face Detection AF/AE sets the focus point and exposure for the faces of your subjects. Face Detection FE adjusts the flash to correctly illuminate your subject to provide the best balance between your subject and the overall scene, eliminating the common problems of over- and underexposed faces. Face Detection in action 

Red-eye correction detects and corrects red-eye during playback. In unusual cases where red-eye is not automatically detected, it can easily be corrected manually during playback mode. 

iSAPS technology is an entirely original scene-recognition technology developed for digital cameras by Canon. Using an internal database of thousands of different photos, iSAPS works with the fast DIGIC III Image Processor to improve focus speed and accuracy, as well as exposure and white balance. 

Easy-to-use Mode Dial with a wide range of shooting modes With a simple Mode Dial, the PowerShot A720 IS makes it easy to access the features of the camera you’ll use most. Select a scene mode, and the camera automatically sets shooting parameters to get you the best possible shot in that situation. You can also access Stitch Assist, Auto, Movie and Manual modes from the Mode Dial. And the convenience of using AA-size batteries, no special power adapters or chargers are needed wherever you go. 

With 19 Shooting Modes including 7 Special Scene Modes, you’re ready for whatever shot comes your way. 

Compatible with a wide range of accessories including wide-angle and telephoto lens converters The PowerShot A720 IS is compatible with many of shooting accessories such as wide and tele converter lenses, High-Power Flash designed for all of the PowerShot models. Also, a waterproof case is available for your underwater shooting. 

Print/Share button for easy direct printing and downloading The PowerShot A720 IS's Print/Share button makes direct printing easier than ever. Simply connect the A720 IS to a Canon CP, Selphy or Pixma Photo Printer or any PictBridge compatible photo printer, press the lighted Print/Share button and print! Also use the Print/Share button to transfer images to a computer (Windows and Macintosh). 

Print your own ID photos in 28 different sizes or use the Movie Print function to output multiple stills from a recorded movie on a single sheet with a Canon Selphy Compact Photo Printer. 

Direct photo printers For desktop large-format printing, try one of the direct photo printers that allow you to print without a computer in one of two ways: plug your compatible PowerShot camera into the direct photo printer using the supplied USB interface cable, or simply insert a memory card into the supplied adapter. You can also connect the printer to your computer for more options. Print high-resolution, borderless images as postcards or 8.5 x 11-inch sheets within minutes. 

Compact photo printers Compact photo printers let you produce versatile, fun 4 x 6-inch postcards, 4 x 8-inch wide greeting cards or credit card size prints in just two easy steps: connect and press/print. Control the printer right from your camera's LCD screen. You get durable, dye-sublimated prints quickly with or without borders. Assorted paper types let you create mini or credit card size labels. You can even take select compact photo printers to a party or an outdoor picnic using an optional rechargeable battery.
feature_bullets: 8-megapixel CCD captures enough detail for photo-quality 16 x 22-inch prints
6x image-stabilized optical zoom; 2.5-inch wide-viewing-angle LCD display
Face Detection technology and in-camera red-eye fix
19 shooting modes, including 7 special scene modes; Print/Share button
Powered by 2 AA-size batteries (2 alkaline batteries included); stores images on SD memory cards (16MB memory card included)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars381 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
